title: Surface Tension and Capillary Action - Multiple Choice Questions
subtitle: NIOS Class 12 Physics - Chapter 9 (Part 2)

questions.question: Surface tension is defined as:
options: Both force per unit length and energy per unit area
questions.explanation: Surface tension can be defined as force per unit length (T = F/L) or as surface energy per unit area (T = W/A). Both definitions are equivalent.

questions.question: The SI unit of surface tension is:
questions.explanation: The SI unit of surface tension is N/m (Newton per meter), representing force per unit length.

questions.question: Surface tension arises due to:
questions.explanation: Surface tension arises due to intermolecular forces, particularly the cohesive forces between molecules at the surface.

questions.question: Molecules at the surface of a liquid experience:
questions.explanation: Surface molecules experience a net downward force because they have fewer neighboring molecules above them compared to molecules inside the liquid.

questions.question: Free drops of liquid assume spherical shape because:
options: Sphere has minimum surface area for given volume
questions.explanation: Liquid drops assume spherical shape because surface tension tends to minimize surface area, and sphere has minimum surface area for a given volume.

questions.question: The force of adhesion is the attractive force between:
questions.explanation: Adhesive force is the attractive force between molecules of two different substances, like water and glass.

questions.question: The force of cohesion is the attractive force between:
questions.explanation: Cohesive force is the attractive force between molecules of the same substance, like water molecules with each other.

questions.question: Water wets glass because:
questions.explanation: Water wets glass because adhesive forces between water and glass molecules are greater than cohesive forces between water molecules.

questions.question: Mercury does not wet glass because:
questions.explanation: Mercury doesn't wet glass because cohesive forces between mercury atoms are greater than adhesive forces between mercury and glass.

questions.question: Surface energy of a liquid is:
options: Work done to increase surface area
questions.explanation: Surface energy is the work done to increase the surface area of a liquid by bringing molecules from the interior to the surface.

questions.question: The angle of contact is measured:
questions.explanation: The angle of contact is defined as the angle between the liquid surface and container wall, measured from within the liquid.

questions.question: For water in a glass tube, the angle of contact is:
questions.explanation: Water in glass has an acute angle of contact (less than 90°) because water wets glass, forming a concave meniscus.

questions.question: For mercury in a glass tube, the angle of contact is:
questions.explanation: Mercury in glass has an obtuse angle of contact (greater than 90°) because mercury doesn't wet glass, forming a convex meniscus.

questions.question: Capillary action is the phenomenon of:
options: Rise or depression of liquid in narrow tubes
questions.explanation: Capillary action is the phenomenon of rise or depression of liquid in narrow tubes (capillaries) due to surface tension.

questions.question: The height of liquid rise in a capillary tube is given by:
questions.explanation: The height of capillary rise is h = 2T cosθ / (rρg), where T is surface tension, θ is contact angle, r is tube radius, ρ is density, and g is gravitational acceleration.

questions.question: Capillary rise is inversely proportional to:
questions.explanation: From h = 2T cosθ / (rρg), capillary rise is inversely proportional to tube radius r. Smaller radius gives greater rise.

questions.question: Excess pressure inside a spherical liquid drop of radius r is:
questions.explanation: Excess pressure inside a spherical liquid drop is 2T/r, where T is surface tension and r is radius.

questions.question: Excess pressure inside a soap bubble in air is:
questions.explanation: A soap bubble has two surfaces (inner and outer), so excess pressure is 4T/r, twice that of a liquid drop.

questions.question: Excess pressure inside an air bubble in water is:
questions.explanation: An air bubble in water has only one surface (the inner surface), so excess pressure is 2T/r.

questions.question: Detergents are effective cleaning agents because they:
questions.explanation: Detergents decrease surface tension of water, allowing it to penetrate between fibers and dislodge dirt particles more effectively.

questions.question: The phenomenon that allows mosquitoes to walk on water is:
questions.explanation: Surface tension creates an elastic-like surface film that can support the light weight of mosquitoes without breaking.

questions.question: Surface tension generally decreases with:
questions.explanation: Surface tension decreases with increasing temperature because intermolecular forces weaken as molecular kinetic energy increases.

questions.question: When the angle of contact is 90°, the liquid surface becomes:
questions.explanation: When the angle of contact is 90°, adhesive and cohesive forces balance, resulting in a horizontal liquid surface.

questions.question: Blotting paper absorbs ink due to:
questions.explanation: Blotting paper has numerous narrow pores that act as capillaries, drawing ink upward through capillary action.

questions.question: Plants transport water from roots to leaves through:
questions.explanation: Plants use capillary action in their vascular tissues (xylem) to transport water from roots to leaves against gravity.

questions.question: The work done in forming a soap film on a rectangular frame is:
questions.explanation: Work done = 2T × A because a soap film has two surfaces, and work equals surface tension times the total increase in surface area.

questions.question: When inner film of a soap bubble is punctured, the cotton thread takes circular shape due to:
questions.explanation: Surface tension of the remaining outer film pulls the thread into a circular shape to minimize the surface area.

questions.question: Camphor boat moves on water surface due to:
questions.explanation: Camphor dissolves in water and locally reduces surface tension, creating an imbalance that propels the boat.

questions.question: The rise of oil in the wick of a lamp is due to:
questions.explanation: Oil rises in the wick through capillary action in the narrow spaces between wick fibers.

questions.question: For a liquid to rise in a capillary tube, the angle of contact should be:
questions.explanation: For capillary rise, cos θ must be positive, which occurs when θ < 90° (acute angle of contact).

questions.question: Mercury level in a capillary tube dipped in mercury will:
questions.explanation: Mercury has an obtuse contact angle with glass, so it shows capillary depression rather than rise.

questions.question: The force that acts upward on mosquito legs touching water surface is:
questions.explanation: The vertical component of surface tension acting along the line of contact balances the mosquito's weight.

questions.question: Spherical shape of rain drops is due to:
questions.explanation: Surface tension minimizes surface area, making raindrops spherical for maximum volume with minimum surface area.

questions.question: If radius of a spherical drop is halved, its excess pressure becomes:
questions.explanation: Since P = 2T/r, if radius is halved, excess pressure doubles (P ∝ 1/r).

questions.question: Addition of soap to water:
options: Has no effect on surface tension
First increases then decreases surface tension
questions.explanation: Soap molecules have hydrophilic heads and hydrophobic tails that disrupt the hydrogen bonding between water molecules, reducing surface tension.

questions.question: The meniscus of water in a glass tube is:
questions.explanation: Water forms a concave meniscus in glass because adhesive forces between water and glass exceed cohesive forces in water.

questions.question: Two soap bubbles of different radii are connected by a tube. Air will flow from:
questions.explanation: Smaller bubble has higher pressure (P = 4T/r), so air flows from smaller to larger bubble until pressure equalizes.

questions.question: Which liquid will rise highest in identical capillary tubes?
questions.explanation: Capillary rise depends on surface tension, density, and contact angle with tube material. Different liquids behave differently with different materials.

questions.question: Farmers plow fields after rain to:
questions.explanation: Plowing breaks capillaries in soil, preventing water from reaching the surface through capillary action, conserving soil moisture.

questions.question: The dimensions of surface tension are:
questions.explanation: Surface tension = Force/Length, so dimensions are [MLT⁻²]/[L] = [MT⁻²].
